name: Four Points by Sheraton BWI Airport

reviews.title: The location and hotel itself were fine. The staff disrespectful
reviews.text: We stayed at the Four Points Sheraton BWI for one night. We chose this hotel based upon several things. We are starwood preferred members, location and the reviews written here.While the hotel itself is perfect for airport travel the staff was the worst i have dealt with while traveling. Good points were the size of the king deluxe room and no airport noise. The bad points were dealing with Kevin Carnes the general manager and the bartender in the hotel. I have never in my life been treated with such disrespect. I will most likely not be staying here again.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before an early morning flight out of BWI. From the outside the hotel doesn't look like anything great - but inside is very nice and they have done a good job keeping it up. The rooms have been renovated nicely (flat screens, comfortable beds), and it was very clean. Our only criticism was that it was the smallest bath ever! You can't stay any closer to BWI, although the area around there isn't great. Your best bet for dinner or an outing is to go to Arundel Mills by car (about 15 mins). The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

I've used tripadvisor for a while now, but this is my first time writing a review. Our Four Points room was spacious and clean. Our business was in downtown Baltimore and it took about fifteen minutes (by car) to get to our destination near the inner harbor. I recommend this hotel if you don't mind the drive downtown. The price for similar rooms downtown started about 250$ and went up from there. My total at four points was 100 dollars including all taxes and fees.
reviews.title: Great room for price, but read on ....

reviews.text: One IMPORTANT note: request a room on the opposite side of the runway! We could hear the planes taking off until abour 1130 pm or so.
reviews.title: Good Stay!!...Beware You're on TSA Property!!

likes.liked: — The updated decor and comfy beds.

reviews.text: My Father and I stayed here the Aug 3-6, 2007 for a family reunion. This is an older property but the remodel was great! The rooms have gold fixtures in the bath and flat screen TVs. The beds were comfy and everything was very clean. Very nice new decor. The layout of the entire hotel is less than desired. It seemed as though the hallways were designed as an afterthought. Somehow they messed up my reservation and they cancelled our room. My bad for not checking up behind them!!! If it were not for the unfortunate events that happened our first night I would have given it a better rating. There were 2 family reunions at the same time, which kept the hotel very busy. Granted, hotel security did a great job at handling it but there was severe overkill when the guard pulled a fire alarm at 2:00am when he thought he smelled cigar smoke coming from a room. Duuuh!! This evacuated the whole hotel and had old and young standing out in the parking lot in rollers and PJs. After the Fire Dept. left, 6 TSA Officers showed up and proceeded to throw out the person whose room it was. The next day, someone was smoking weed in their room (it could be smelled in the hall)and security went knocking on every door pretending to be housekeeping. When no one answered, they proceeded to open each door and see if they could smell anything. (Don't know how legal all this was!?!) They found the culprits called TSA and had them put out. I would definitely stay there again. But, with the knowledge that they are NOT having ANY foolishness!!!
reviews.title: Right next to the airport

likes.liked: — Next to Baltimore airport. Very nice staff.
likes.disliked: — Poor lighting and the pillows were too big.

reviews.text: I stayed here with my 4 and 6 year old boys when my husband was in Baltimore on business. We switched to this hotel at the last minute because it was going to be extremely hot and they looked like they had a nice pool area. We were very pleased with our decision. The olypmic-sized pool was very clean and warm and there was an actual lifeguard on duty. As other reviewers mentioned, the staff is very pleasant and knowledgable about the area, with directions on hand to just about everywhere in Baltimore. We also used the convenient and prompt airport van service to catch the light rail system to the inner harbor--my boys thought this was quite an adventure. They even had a children's menu for room service, which I appreciated after a long day of sightseeing with two young boys. Like the other reviewers said, try the crab soup! Great hotel!
reviews.title: Pleased with the amenities at Four Points BWI

likes.disliked: — Cable TV was aimed mostly at men

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 12-hr layover in Baltimore, far too long to hang out at the airport with our luggage. We booked the room at $120 through Priceline. The other reviews are correct, this is a very nice place to stay. We only used the room for the day, but took a nap and a shower and can confirm that both the bed and the bathroom are more than you'd expect at this price. The room a/c unit was a bit noisy, which might be a problem at night, but it was definitely appreciated in the 100-degree heat! The free bottle of water is a nice touch. Otherwise, the staff were very friendly, the hotel pool looked like it belonged in a tropical resort. We didn't try the restaurant but the room service menu looked appealing. It was worth the cost to spend the day at the inner harbor, instead of in the airport waiting area. Although we learned at check-out that they have a half-day rate, which is only available if the reservation isn't pre-paid. Good thing to know for next time!

The moment I stepped into the room after I check-in, the room smelled stuffy, I guess it is because air condition was not on? However, the smell was gone really fast. But the corridor had a cigarette smell…
reviews.title: Great value. Good for stopver
Very nice rooms and close to airport
reviews.text: Again, room is nice, I got a King bed room, it is spacious enough. However washroom is a bit small, good for 1 to 2 people only. Shower was very good, water is strong from shower head. I enjoyed my shower a lot! TV was nice, a lot of lighting in the room, bright enough. I like their working desk, there are wheels on one of them, plus there are enough seatings. However, they have no mini-fridge or microwave. Something I was not expected.
I would give it a B to the room, but service, it would be a F!

reviews.title: Excellent Service, Convenient Location

reviews.text: I'm actually still in the room, but had to write this review while it was still in my head. I'm in customer service and travel a bit (especially lately) for my job. Therefore, I think I have higher expectations for service professionals than most. Everything the other reviews say about the good location, ample parking and proximity to the airport is correct. However, the thing that stands out in my mind is the service.
